And I wouldn’t call C# a ‘C language’ anymore than I would call Java one.

item.title: C++ cin command help?
item.dc:creator: @Zeldas Zeldas*
item.description:
@Zeldas wrote:

Maybe I’m a nerd, but if I did log into a private server I wouldn’t want it screaming at me in CAPS or saying UR. Also they are right, if you do want to use such commands as ‘cin’ and ‘cout’ you’ll need to remeber proper case is important, EVERYTHING CAN’T BE IN CAPS and if you refuse to use ‘using namespace std;’ you’ll have to type std:: infront of all such commands that require so, also I think you need to include something like ‘include<string.h>’ or something… I don’t really know, I’ve only written one of two programs in C++ so far, working on learning the rest, only dedicated afew hours to it one day.

Read full topic

item.title: C++ cin command help?
item.dc:creator: @javedman0208 javedman0208
item.description:
@javedman0208 wrote:

[quote=“zstars, post:6, topic:311552”][quote author=javedman0208 link=topic=408000.msg3012509#msg3012509 date=1256916874]
Whats the command? i need the output to be :
TYPE UR NAME HERE: __________________
UR NAME IS ___________ WELCOME TO JAVEDSCAPE;

Regards,[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 30, 2009, 10:22:35 am[/size][hr]EDIT: i think if fond out now;

[code]string name[10];

COUT<<“TYPE UR NAME HERE :”;
CIN>>name;

COUT<<" UR NAME IS “<<name<<” WELCOME TO JAVEDSCAPE"<<endl;[/code]

Lock this now please.
[/quote]

If you really intend to learn C++, get a good (e)book. “Accelerated C++, Practical Programming by Example”, for instance.

Might also want to compile your code before assuming it is right, as the code you posted would never compile. If you are particularly lazy or have no access to a C++ compiler, you have http://www.codepad.org .

Just innocent curiosity, which C languages have you been programming since 06?[/quote]

I should reinstate that to “Learning since 06” C# and C . I took a course in computer scince in IB (International Baccalaureate). Thanks anyway, i dont know why this is still open.

Read full topic

Might also want to compile your code before assuming it is right, as the code you posted would never compile. If you are particularly lazy or have no access to a C++ compiler, you have http://www.codepad.org .

Just innocent curiosity, which C languages have you been programming since 06?

item.title: C++ cin command help?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

It’s “cin” and “cout” not “CIN” and “COUT”.

Also, it’s actually std::cin and std::cout, so you’ll need using namespace std; somewhere in scope if you’re going to use it like that.

Read full topic
